channel.title: The Ark
channel.description: The Ark is the weekly newspaper of Tiburon, Belvedere and Strawberry

item.title: Belvedere could recover $545,000 a year with fee boost
item.description: Belvedere would recover more costs from development projects and free up general-fund money for citywide initiatives.
item.dc:creator: Naomi Friedland

item.title: Belvedere sergeant is recognized for saving a jogger’s life — with assist from high schooler
item.description: Sgt. Jeremy Clark performed CPR on an out-of-town jogger, a man in his 50s who was not breathing and had no pulse.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: A lifetime of learning: Former Belvedere Nursery School student marks 40 years of leadership
item.description: Mrs. Parker will be recognized March 22 for her decades of leadership and for fostering connections among students, staff and parents.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Tree trimmer killed in fall at Tiburon home
item.description: The man fell from a tree he was trimming at a Centro West Street home into a neighbor’s backyard.
item.dc:creator: Naomi Friedland

item.title: Belvedere makes progress on communication, survey says
item.description: While just 72 people responded, they said they want more updates on council actions, disaster preparedness
item.dc:creator: Naomi Friedland

item.title: Tiburon, Belvedere will see 3% increase in dues for Richardson Bay agency
item.description: Under the increase, Tiburon will pay $179,618 next year, and Belvedere will pay $134,130.
item.dc:creator: Gretchen Lang

item.title: Everyday Encounters: A peninsula pair reflects on a cross-generational friendship
item.description: Their friendship bridges a 23-year age gap, sparked by a chance encounter and conversation while getting coffee downtown about 10 years ago.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Belvedere-Tiburon Library exhibit showcases artists’ personal narratives, life stories
item.description: “Artists’ Narratives: Their History and Identity” runs March 20-May 7, featuring 58 pieces selected by nine jurists.
item.dc:creator: Diane Smith
